content: What is the name of the 19th-century novel by Leo Tolstoy, which explores themes of love and betrayal among Russian high society?

You're referring to "Anna Karenina," a novel by Leo Tolstoy published in serial form from 1873 to 1877. It's considered one of the greatest works of literature, exploring themes of love, marriage, society, and moral values through the lives of its characters in Russian high society. The story revolves around Anna Karenina, a married woman who has an affair with Count Vronsky, leading to tragic consequences. The novel also delves into the inner lives of other characters, such as Konstantin Levin, who grapples with questions of faith and purpose. Tolstoy's masterful storytelling and deep psychological insights make "Anna Karenina" a timeless classic.
